intro: Cucubalus foetidus, commonly known as the stinking cucumber, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, foul-smelling flowers that are often described as having a strong, unpleasant odor. The plant produces yellowish-green fruits that are typically small and oblong in shape. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. The botanical features of Cucubalus foetidus make it a unique and often overlooked member of the Cucurbitaceae family.
